intro: Loranthus lanceolatus var. corniculatus, commonly known as the slender dodder, is a parasitic plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the Santalales order and is characterized by its yellow-orange, thread-like stems that缠绕 its hosts. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions, often parasitizing various species of woody plants. Due to its parasitic nature, it can cause significant damage to its host plants if left unchecked.
